title: As regional violence rages, Saudi Arabia pitches itself as investment hub
description: The summit in Riyadh, known as the Future Investment Initiative, allowed the kingdom to showcase its ambitious plans to reshape its economy.
author: Susannah George
excerpt: The summit in Riyadh, known as the Future Investment Initiative, allowed the kingdom to showcase its ambitious plans to reshape its economy.
text: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia — At a glitzy investment summit here last week, there was little mention of the wars raging elsewhere in the Middle East. Instead, there were ads for robot-fueled megacities, talk of flying taxis, and Western business executives urging audiences to “rethink what is possible.”For Saudi Arabia, the summit, known as the Future Investment Initiative, is meant to showcase ambitious plans to reshape its economy — trying to pitch itself to global investors as a hub for artificial intelligence, finance and tourism, despite a record of leveraging technology for repression and spying on dissidents.
html:
RIYADH, Saudi Arabia — At a glitzy investment summit here last week, there was little mention of the wars raging elsewhere in the Middle East. Instead, there were ads for robot-fueled megacities, talk of flying taxis, and Western business executives urging audiences to “rethink what is possible.”

For Saudi Arabia, the summit, known as the Future Investment Initiative, is meant to showcase ambitious plans to reshape its economy — trying to pitch itself to global investors as a hub for artificial intelligence, finance and tourism, despite a record of leveraging technology for repression and spying on dissidents.
